text_feedback: I evaluated the LLM Assistant for summarization in Physics at the graduate level; it reduced my effort on key goals significantly.Feeling anxiety, it sometimes confused me and I remain cautious about fairness and transparency. This shaped my attitude toward AI tools in learning/teaching in a negative way. (note 67a39d)

I evaluated the Concept Mapper for brainstorming in Sociology at the graduate level; it clarified key goals considerably. Feeling anticipation, the pace felt unchanged and I still think about privacy and academic integrity. In practice, this changed how I adapt my study plan and assessments. (note 610923)

I adopted the AI Tutor for note organization in Chemistry at the undergraduate level; it gave me better feedback about key goals moderately. Feeling neutral, results were mixed and I prefer clearer guidance on ethical use. In practice, this changed how I adapt my study plan and assessments. (note bf97a2)

I evaluated the Quiz Generator for language translation in Law at the undergraduate level; it helped me grasp key goals considerably.  Feeling joy, I felt more motivated and I cross-checked outputs to avoid plagiarism. This shaped my attitude toward AI tools in learning/teaching in a positive way. (note f178f1)

I evaluated the AI Tutor for concept explanation in Computer Science at the undergraduate level; it sped up my study of key goals slightly.Feeling joy, I finished tasks faster than usual and I followed our policy on responsible AI use. In practice, this changed how I adapt my study plan and assessments. (note 23e7ad)
